p: In wool-producing countries, flystrike kills millions of heads of sheep a year [ 12]. In Australia, the annual costs of flystrike, including mortality and loss of production, have been estimated at as high as 280 million A$ [ 13]. In Great Britain, myiasis was shown to affect 75% of farms [ 14], with an estimated cost of about 3 million GBP [ 15] a year.
